column2: The Charm Person spell temporarily increases the target's opinion of you, but afterwards they'll realise what you've done and their opinion will go down.

§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nThe Charm Person spell temporarily increases the target's opinion of you, but afterwards they'll realise what you've done and their opinion will go down.
The Charm Person ritual temporarily increases the target's opinion of you, but afterwards they'll realise what you've done and their opinion will go down.

§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this ritual as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nThe Charm Person ritual temporarily increases the target's opinion of you, but afterwards they'll realise what you've done and their opinion will go down.
Perform a ritual to summon a unit of fiends to serve you in war.
Tried to cast spell on me
The Comprehend Languages spell temporarily increases your diplomatic ability.
Open your spellbook to see available spells.
Close your spellbook and access other decisions.
Affected by a negative magical effect
Cast the Dispel spell, cleansing yourself of all temporary magical effects, including beneficial ones.
Cast the Disrupt Undead spell, which lowers the combat abilities of an undead enemy leader and has a chance to wipe out undead troops.
[From.GetBestName] has cast the Disrupt Undead spell!
Must be Journeyman Wizard or higher.
Must be Master Wizard or higher.
The Banish spell allows you to attempt to remove an Outsider character from this plane of existence permantently.

§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nThe Banish spell allows you to attempt to remove an Outsider character who you a rival, at war with or have reason to imprison from this plane of existence permantently.
Wild surge! Your spell has slipped from your control and churns chaotically! Anything could happen now!
Your skin is glowing purple, which is quite ridiculous.
Recovered from a wild magic surge
Cast the Longevity spell, greatly increasing your lifespan. This has a small chance of failure, where nothing will happen.
[From.GetBestName] has tried to cast the Banish spell on you!
The spell Alustriel's Mantle creates a magical protection over the troops lead by this character.
Cast the Alustriel's Mantle spell, giving soldiers under your leadership magical protection against enemy attacks for a short while.
Cast the Nezram's Amethyst Aura spell, boosting your health.
Cast the Remove Disease spell to cure a disease from the target character.
Cast the Remove Disease spell to attempt to cure a disease from the target province.

§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision §G for either characters or provinces!§!\n\nCast the Remove Disease spell to cure a disease from the target character, or attempt to cure a plague on a province.
[From.GetBestName] has taken pity on me and used [From.GetHerHis] magic to cure me from one of my diseases!
By using your magic, you have rid yourself of one of the diseases afflicting you.
One of the diseases will be cured.
[From.GetBestName] has taken pity on me and used [From.GetHerHis] magic to cure my lands from the disease ravaging it!
By using your magic, you have rid [From.GetName] of the disease afflicting it.
Your attempts to heal [From.GetName] have failed.
Cast the Spell Mantle spell, increasing your resistance to hostile magical effects.
Cast the Planar Binding spell, summoning an outsider to serve you. You have no control over what kind of outsider is bound.
Cast the Burn Path spell, preventing the target from using arcane spells for the duration.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nCast the Burn Path spell, preventing the target from using arcane spells for the duration.
This character is temporarily unable to cast arcane magic
Rather suddenly you find yourself unable to use arcane magic! At the same time, you see [From.GetBestName] lurking nearby.
Cast the Slow spell, causing the targetted enemy commander's army to move slower.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nCast the Slow spell, causing the targetted enemy commander's army to move slower.
This character has been subjected to the Slow spell, which extends to [Root.GetHerHis] army!
Suddenly you feel sluggish. There is no doubt in your mind, [From.GetBestName] has cast a spell on you!
Cast the Longstrider spell on yourself, causing any armies you are leading to move faster.
The longstrider spell causes both this character and any soldiers [Root.GetSheHe] commands to move faster.
Cast the fabricate spell, reducing build costs in the settlement's province for a small while.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rsettlement decision§!\n\nCast the fabricate spell, reducing build costs in the settlement's province for a small while.
Cast the Create Homunculus spell, creating a little construct to aid you, at the additional cost of a wound.
Homunculi are small constructs created by wizards out of various materials, and their own blood, to act as assistants.
Cast the Tenser's Transformation spell, briefly increasing your skill at personal combat.
Cast the Disintegrate spell, making an attempt to kill the target.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nCast the Disintegrate spell, making an attempt to kill the target.
You are ambushed by [From.GetBestName], who grimly points at you and shoots a beam of light from [Get.HerHis] hand. When it hits you, you are wracked by agony!
Cast the Mordekainen's Faithful Hound spell, summoning an incorporeal watchdog that can warn you about threats.
Cast the Find Familiar spell, acquiring a small magical creature to act as a little helper and who can take the shapes of various small animals.
Familiars are spirits that take the form of small animals upon bonding with a wizard. They then share a mental link to said wizard and help them on various taks.
Cast the Summon Lesser Demons spell, conjuring up an army of outsiders to fight for you for a few months.
Doesn't have summoned troops of this type already.
Cast the Conjure Elementals spell, spawning a group of elemental troops to fight for you for a few months.
Cast the Greater Planar Binding spell, summoning an outsider with good stats to serve you. You have no control over what kind of outsider is bound.
Cast the Incendiary Cloud spell, dealing damage to troops in the enemy army.
Cast the Detect Thoughts spell, increasing your chance of dicovering plots in your court.
Cast the Forget Past spell, removing almost all opinions of the target towards you.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nCast the Forget Past spell, removing almost all opinions of the target towards you.
Will remove almost all opinions towards me.
Cast the Probe Thoughts spell, getting a favour on the target at the cost of them dislike you messing with their thoughts.

§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nCast the Probe Thoughts spell, getting a favour on the target at the cost of them dislike you messing with their thoughts.
Cast the Legend Lore spell, gaining bonuses on diplomacy, stewardship and learning.
Cast the Anticipation spell, revealing all plots in your court.
Cast the Rage Spell, granting troops under your command increased damage, but decreased defence.
The Rage spell causes troops under your command to both deal and receive more damage.
Cast the Crown of Madness spell, rendering the target temporarily insane.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nCast the Crown of Madness spell, rendering the target temporarily insane.
You can finally see it. The Truth behind the world, behind the action of all these people-puppets around you. You can See it.
Rather suddenly you feel your mind clearing and you remember: [From.GetBestName] cast a spell on you! Maybe it was the source of your madness!
Cast the Cathala's Compulsion spell, causing the target to instantly become your rival.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nCast the Cathala's Compulsion spell, causing the target to instantly become your rival.
Cast the Mordekainen's Involuntary Wizardry spell, forcing the target to experience a Wild Magic Surge.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nCast the Mordekainen's Involuntary Wizardry spell, forcing the target to experience a Wild Magic Surge.
To your confusion and horror, you watch helpless as your body starts to cast an arcane spell.
I have a bad feeling about this...
Cast the Dominate Person spell, guaranteeing their loyalty for a period of time.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nCast the Dominate Person spell, guaranteeing their loyalty for a period of time.
Perform the Dominate Person ritual, guaranteeing a character's loyalty for a period of time.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nPerform the Dominate Person ritual, guaranteeing a character's loyalty for a period of time.
Cast the Fireball spell, causing minor damage to enemy troops.
Cast the Magic Missile spell, attempting to wound or kill the target.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nCast the Magic Missile spell, attempting to wound or kill the target.
You are ambushed by [From.GetBestName], who gestures and fires bolts of magic from [Get.HerHis] hand. When they hit you, pain overtakes you.
[From.GetBestName] has cast the Lightning Bolt spell!
Cast the Lightning Bolt spell, attempting to kill, or at least wound, a leader in an enemy army.
You are ambushed by [From.GetBestName], who gestures and a bolt of lightning from [Get.HerHis] hand. When it hits you, pain overtakes your body.
Cast the Wall of Stone spell, increasing the fort level of a besieged province.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rsettlement decision§!\n\nCast the Wall of Stone spell, increasing the fort level of a besieged province.
Cast the Chain Lightning spell, dealing damage to troops in the enemy army.
Cast the Maddening Darkness spell, dealing morale damage to troops in the enemy army.
Cast the Phantom Steed spell, gaining a bonus to personal combat due to a temporary magical mount.
Cast the Alustriel's Banner spell, granting troops under your command improved morale.
The Alustriel's Banner spell increases the morale of troops under this character.
Perform the Phantasmal Force ritual, summoning a unit of illusory soldiers to aid in your wars.
[From.GetBestName] has cast the Incendiary Cloud spell!
[From.GetBestName] has cast the Chain Lightning spell!
[From.GetBestName] has cast the Maddening Darkness spell!
Cast the Phantasmal Killer spell, giving the target various negative effects.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nCast the Phantasmal Killer spell, giving the target various negative effects.

For a moment, you think you spy [From.GetBestName], but you don't have time to react to [From.GetHerHis] presence as a terrible monster assaults you. Only after some moments do you realise its illusory nature, but it left you shaken nonetheless.
Cast the Weird spell, dealing morale damage to troops in the enemy army.
Cast the Mind Prison spell, rendering the target temporarily incapable.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nCast the Mind Prison spell, rendering the target temporarily incapable.
You find that your thoughts are getting slower and slower. Soon you can barely control your own body.
Cast the Animate Dead spell, summoning a force of undead troops.\n\n§GThere is also a §Rsettlement decisions§G version of this spell!§!
Cast the Animate Dead spell, summoning a force of undead troops. If cast on a province populated by the living, this will cause a negative reaction.
Cast the False Life spell, increasing your health.
Cast the Bestow Curse spell, lowering the target's attributes for a while.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rtargeted decision§!\n\nCast the Bestow Curse spell, lowering the target's attributes for a while.

For a moment, you think you see [From.GetBestName] lucky nearby. But when you try to confront [From.GetHerHim], [From.GetSheHe] is nowhere to be seen. Since then, you've been feeling distinctly unlucky.
Cast the Create Undead spell, spawning an undead character in your court that is loyal to you.
Cast the Blight spell, unleashing a disease upon a province. Your character must have a very low opinion of the local ruler to use this decision.

§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rsettlement decision§!\n\nCast the Blight spell, unleashing a disease upon a province. Your character must have a very low opinion of the local ruler to use this decision.
[From.GetBestName] has unleashed a disease on your lands!

Perform the Cloning ritual, creating a clone "child" after your own image. A clone is initially inert, only waking up after its creator dies. There is always a small chance that a clone may die while trying to wake up. Any further clones of the same being will be hostile to each other.
This character is a clone, created by magic by a spellcaster in their own image.
Upon creation, clones remain in magical stasis, only becoming active after the death of their creator.
As your soul and mind settle in a new body, you decide that from now on you will be named:
Cast the Lichdom spell, turning you into an ageless undead creature. This has a small chance of failure, where nothing will happen.
Cast the Nahal's Reckless Dweomer spell, gaining a quantity of spell points back... but with a large risk of a wild magic surge instead.
After gathering the necessary materials you think you'll need, you start the arduous process of researching a new spell.
Start the process of learning a new wizardly spell.
Enemy army has either an undead leader or troops

Cast the Control Weather spell, improving the weather in one of your provinces, or making it worse in someone else's province. Your character must have a very low opinion of the local ruler to use this decision.

§GThis is merely a reminder that you have this spell as a §Rsettlement decision§!\n\nCast the Control Weather spell, changing the weather in the province. Your character must have a very low opinion of the local ruler to use this decision.
